name: Japanese Music
description: Japanese meta-genre covers all forms of music, traditional or contemporary, rooted in Japanese Folk Music.

children.name: Eleki
children.description: Japanese Surf Rock that emerged during the early to mid-1960s, incorporating elements of Japanese Folk Music.

children.name: Enka
children.description: Evolved from Ryūkōka in the mid-1950s, based around the pentatonic scale and with a lyrical focus on expressive and emotional topics such as love, loss, loneliness, and death.

children.name: Ryūkōka
children.description: Uses elements of Western Classical Music, and adopts the legato style of singing.
